title: creating a game like league. plz join in discussion
body:
a game like league is complex. so many balance issues. everyone wants their mains to be strong while anything they doe to to get gutted. lets try starting a chain/train of thought and attempt to have a biased free discussion.
ex1) u have the adc. the long range fighter whos main form of damage is long range auto attacks. to keep this simple lets go with a swordsman to oppose this champion. how do we make i fair? if the adc has range advantage, how do me make it fair for the swordsman? common sense is to make it so the swordsman gets rewarded for catching up to the adc. that doesnt more damage against the adc, but some kind of reward. also, should the swordsman have the tools available to him to catch the adc? or should he need help from his teammates? lrespond with ur answers and post ur own questions and have someone else answer. remember , dont get too detailed. this is just to have an idea of how riot has to tackle issues games like league provide.

replies.body: Gap closers or an escape should be essential on all melee fighters. how else would they get the last hit on a weakened foe. Also should every new champion some outrageous damage/armor ability why does it take all new champions months and months to nerfed. Like {{champion:223}}  for example his tankiness @ level 6 rivals that of a {{champion:201}}  @ level 10. it's ridiculous. Riot crews need more balance to the game.  Also should a {{champion:203}} possess the power to 3 hit a tank like {{champion:98}} when he has killed her multiple times already?

however if all mellee fighters have a gapcloser, whats the counterplay option that ranged fighters have? just a thought. as for ur tank problem,  early game tanks should indeed have a counter, at this point in time the only counter is if they horribly misposition or are just bad at the game, which should be unacceptable. what would u recomend riot does to adjust this imbalance? my opinion would be to not allow tanks to do damage early. none at all. if theyre anywhere near as tanky as tahm. that would leave him as a punching bag for awhile until he gets a few levels, which by then the enemy should have a fair chance as well. as for kindred. % health isnt a healthy mechanic unless it is extremely limited , in this case its not. a short cooldown + kite. however, as a tank, shen shouldnt be allowed to kill her in a fair fight early game anyways. it seems like kindred killing shen early (despite being behind) is only fair, however he should be allowed to snowball that lead into a mid game monster who wont die to her. ur thoughts?

But when the shen already has say 3 kills on Kindred already then not even 5 minutes later she can 3 if not 2 hit him. tell me where the balance is inbetween that >5minute span of time.
The swordsman does more damage than the long ranged fighter or make them have some sort of gap close to get closer to the longranged fighter,That simple. {{champion:77}} running at a {{champion:51}}
but how fun would that be for the adc? if he has the tools to get to u, then theres no advantagd the adc has,  right? especially if they do more dmg
Thats like a man with a gun vs a rhino charging right at him,shoot the rhino b4 it kills him or run away,the ranged guy always has an advantage .range

but u cant 1 shot in league .-.  plus in this case the rhino is stronger. thats what im saying. assuming u cant 1 shot the rhino, what fun is it for the hunter as soon as the rhino is in its face? and is it fair for the rhino to be alot stronger?

The hunter has range so he can take out the rhino with a few shots if not than the hunter is dead,but thats why the rhino has a herd to help him out,and the hunter has his son right beside him to back him up just incase
